main_definition: To remove or eliminate something, especially from a list, document, or digital medium.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In the context of files and documents, to erase or remove content or data permanently.
meanings_and_examples.example: After realizing she had accidentally deleted her project file, Emma frantically searched for a backup.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To excise something from a written work or text
meanings_and_examples.example: The editor deleted several paragraphs to improve the flow of the article.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In social media, to unfollow someone on platforms like Twitter or Instagram.
meanings_and_examples.example: He decided to delete his ex-girlfriend's account from all his social media profiles after their breakup.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To remove an object or entity from a list, inventory, or database
meanings_and_examples.example: The librarian deleted the books that were overdue to update the library records.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In telecommunications, to disconnect or terminate a service or line.
meanings_and_examples.example: When he moved out of his home phone plan, John had to delete his old landline number from their system.
